end this matter

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If youre using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If youre using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.title: bing.com

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://bing.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbing.com)
### Comment
> Using Adguard DNS default server with default ruleset makes the DNS resolution oscillating. A sniff with Wireshark outlined that bing.com gets resolved to CNAME records which end up being resolved in another CNAME records infinitely until timeout hits in. No resolution to A or AAA records possible.
Username: `@sarumaj`

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ih1iwp2x1oo4sookkk4wckco0kg48okmthzamf3y68.png?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/obzz9lmf9yoow48ssw0kc0wgsk00k4ow1p2e178974.png?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Device or router settings
DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server
System version: | Fritzbox 6660
Browser: | Edge

comment.body: Informed Devs. No filter issue though as it also happens with non-filtering DNS. No issue on Google DNS with local DNS filtering with AdGuard DNS blocking on Android.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://bing.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbing.com)
### Comment
> Using Adguard DNS default server with default ruleset makes the DNS resolution oscillating. A sniff with Wireshark outlined that bing.com gets resolved to CNAME records which end up being resolved in another CNAME records infinitely until timeout hits in. No resolution to A or AAA records possible.
Username: `@sarumaj`

labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://bing.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbing.com)
### Comment
> Using Adguard DNS default server with default ruleset makes the DNS resolution oscillating. A sniff with Wireshark outlined that bing.com gets resolved to CNAME records which end up being resolved in another CNAME records infinitely until timeout hits in. No resolution to A or AAA records possible.
Username: `@sarumaj`

### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://bing.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbing.com)
### Comment
> Using Adguard DNS default server with default ruleset makes the DNS resolution oscillating. A sniff with Wireshark outlined that bing.com gets resolved to CNAME records which end up being resolved in another CNAME records infinitely until timeout hits in. No resolution to A or AAA records possible.
Username: `@sarumaj`

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1</summary>

</details>

Information | Value

If youre using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/172033

issue.title: bing.com

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://bing.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbing.com)
### Comment
> Using Adguard DNS default server with default ruleset makes the DNS resolution oscillating. A sniff with Wireshark outlined that bing.com gets resolved to CNAME records which end up being resolved in another CNAME records infinitely until timeout hits in. No resolution to A or AAA records possible.
Username: `@sarumaj`

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1</summary>

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Device or router settings

System version: | Fritzbox 6660
Browser: | Edge

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://bing.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbing.com)
### Comment
> Using Adguard DNS default server with default ruleset makes the DNS resolution oscillating. A sniff with Wireshark outlined that bing.com gets resolved to CNAME records which end up being resolved in another CNAME records infinitely until timeout hits in. No resolution to A or AAA records possible.

issue.title: bing.com

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://bing.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbing.com)
### Comment
> Using Adguard DNS default server with default ruleset makes the DNS resolution oscillating. A sniff with Wireshark outlined that bing.com gets resolved to CNAME records which end up being resolved in another CNAME records infinitely until timeout hits in. No resolution to A or AAA records possible.
Username: `@sarumaj`

issue.title: Cleanup duplicate rules on some filters part 2

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

There are multiple duplicate rules in the filters.
- 1

BaseFilter (adserver.txt)
```
||meniscigox.digital^$all
||noopapnoeic.digital^$all
```
DutchFilter (specific.txt)
```
afkortingen.nu###banner_right
afkortingen.nu###banner_top
alblasserdamsnieuws.nl##.albla-adlabel
```
- 2

GermanFilter (specific.txt)
```
##.mtbnewsAdBillboardContainer
##.vergleichsinfo
```
SocialFilter (popups.txt)
```
###bg_popup
###overlay
```









### Proposed solution

Consolidate rules if possible.

### Additional information

These rules are duplicated across sections. 
Could you please merge them on the maintainer side if possible?

SpywareFilter (mobile.txt)
`||conversions.appsflyer.com^`

JapaneseFilter (antiadblock.txt)
```
##div[id][class^="popup"][class$="wrap"]
#%#//scriptlet('prevent-fetch', 'pagead2.googlesyndication.com')
```

comment.body: Yeah, pretty sure that they should be blocked, but I can't reproduce on Android phone. Can you craft the rules to block them without `a:not()`?

issue.title: bing.com

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://bing.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbing.com)
### Comment
> Using Adguard DNS default server with default ruleset makes the DNS resolution oscillating. A sniff with Wireshark outlined that bing.com gets resolved to CNAME records which end up being resolved in another CNAME records infinitely until timeout hits in. No resolution to A or AAA records possible.
Username: `@sarumaj`

issue.title: bing.com

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://bing.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbing.com)
### Comment
> Using Adguard DNS default server with default ruleset makes the DNS resolution oscillating. A sniff with Wireshark outlined that bing.com gets resolved to CNAME records which end up being resolved in another CNAME records infinitely until timeout hits in. No resolution to A or AAA records possible.
Username: `@sarumaj`

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ih1iwp2x1oo4sookkk4wckco0kg48okmthzamf3y68.png?nc=1)
</details>
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled</summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/obzz9lmf9yoow48ssw0kc0wgsk00k4ow1p2e178974.png?nc=1)
</details>

### System configuration

Information | Value
--- | ---
AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Device or router settings
DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Default server
System version: | Fritzbox 6660
Browser: | Edge

comment.body: Glad it works again. Strange other sites could be resolved though.

issue.title: bing.com

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://bing.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbing.com)
### Comment
> Using Adguard DNS default server with default ruleset makes the DNS resolution oscillating. A sniff with Wireshark outlined that bing.com gets resolved to CNAME records which end up being resolved in another CNAME records infinitely until timeout hits in. No resolution to A or AAA records possible.
Username: `@sarumaj`

issue.body:

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

### Affected site:
`https://www.telenor.no/`

### Issue:
Site broken (no scrolling).

### Screenshot:
Not needed, as the problem is obvious.

### Problem filter:
* **AdGuard Cookie Notices filter**

### Problem rule:
`cinemark.com,lavazza.it,parcelforce.com,iberostar.com,nsandi.com,forcepoint.com,vodafone.com,sony-asia.com,abnamro.com,avis.de,unipolsai.it,o2.co.uk,tsb.co.uk,sainsburysbank.co.uk,hsbc.co.uk,sunglasshut.com,oakley.com,telekom-dienste.de,zurich.it,ray-ban.com,lavazzagroup.com,sony.*,telenor.no,tescomobile.com,falke.com,disney.pl,thewaltdisneycompany.eu,shopdisney.eu,tuclothing.sainsburys.co.uk,epson.com.br,avisautonoleggio.it,qvc.it,gap.eu,disneyplusdayroom.com,sites.prh.com,khaleejtimes.com,tealium.com,robeco.com,totalenergies.de,centrum24.pl,hsbc.com,newbalance.*,sick.com,aktion-mensch.de,diesel.com,totalenergies.com,zurich.de,cineworld.co.uk,otterbox.de,dropbox.com,penguinrandomhouse.com,familienratgeber.de,barclaycard.co.uk,tuicruises.com,bahia-principe.com,open-telekom-cloud.com,t-systems.com,nh-hotels.de,magentasport.de,goertz.de,stepstone.de,smarthome.de,nuernberger.de,cloud.telekom-dienste.de,tui.com,france.tv,opendns.com,victoriassecret.com,huawei.com,argos.co.uk,tealiumiq.com,ti.com,disney.de,ups.com,macys.com,rakuten.de,telekom.de,trendmicro.com,epson.com,3m.com.tr,command.com.tr,virginmedia.com,francetvinfo.fr,greenmangaming.com,logitech.com,logitechg.com,webex.com###__tealiumGDPRecModal`

### Possible fix:
`telenor.no#$#html { overflow: auto !important; }`

### Note:
`https://www.online.no/` (another Telenor site) has the same cookie popup, so it can be blocked in the same way:
```
online.no###__tealiumGDPRecModal
online.no###global-overlay-background
online.no#$#html { overflow: auto !important; }
```
### Other problem filters:
* **EasyList - Cookie Notices**
`##div.privacy_prompt`

--

* OS/version: Windows 10 Pro 22H2 (x64)
* Browser/version: LibreWolf v124.0.1-1 (x64) [Tracking Protection = Standard]
* Adblock Extension/version: uBlock Origin v1.57.2

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://6klabs.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2F6klabs.com%2F) ### Comment > After checking logs, I think Stealth Mode crashes some features of safe websites. 6klabs uses Spotify API to track which song you're listening right now, but it uses online API connected with Spotify Developer account, it doesn't access local data on pc. Last days more and more pages stop loading "Refused to connect". > > The funny thing is, disabling AdGuard protection with extension, inside app, from tray doesn't do anything, BUT when I completely exit AdGuard not leaving in working in background, all of the websites start working fine as they should. ### Screenshots
